intro: Alyxia pullei, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly Hawaii. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters, with glossy, elliptical leaves. Its showy flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central column. Alyxia pullei is valued for its ornamental beauty and plays an important role in the ecological and cultural heritage of Hawaii.
